Duvida1: How do I obtain a residence visa in Brazil?
Resposta1: To obtain a residence visa in Brazil, you should contact the Brazilian consulate or embassy in your home country before traveling. After arriving in Brazil, you must register with the Federal Police within 30 days.
Duvida2: Do I need a visa to work in Brazil?
Resposta2: Yes, to work legally in Brazil, you will need a work visa. Your employer must apply for a work permit from the Ministry of Labor and Employment (MTE), and you must apply for the visa at the Brazilian consulate.
Duvida3: What documents are needed to live in Brazil?
Resposta3: The basic documents include a valid passport, appropriate visa, Birth Certificate, Criminal Record Certificate, and registration with the Federal Police (RNE - National Registry of Foreigners). Some documents need to be translated and authenticated.
Duvida4: How do I open a bank account in Brazil?
Resposta4: To open a bank account in Brazil, you will need documents such as a passport, proof of residence, CPF (Individual Taxpayer Registry), and RNE. You can go to any bank with these documents to open the account.
Duvida5: How do I obtain a CPF (Individual Taxpayer Registry)?

Duvida6: Can I bring my family with me? How does the visa for family members work?
Resposta6: Yes, you can bring your family. Family members (spouse and children) can apply for a family reunion visa, which must be requested at the Brazilian consulate with documentation proving the family relationship.
